alert.note: Alert for Pleasants; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:24AM EST until February 21 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Pleasants and Tyler. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 AM EST, the automated gauge at Middle Island Creek at Little was at 14.51 feet and is slowly rising. At stages above 14 feet, the field opposite of the gauge as well as Stewarts Run Road floods. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of West Central Tyler and Northeastern Pleasants Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
